subject: p11052935
Findings: Frontal and lateral views of the chest were obtained. The lungs are hyperinflated. There is no focal consolidation, pleural effusion or pneumothorax. Small focal opacity projects over the lateral right lower hemithorax, may represent overlapping structures, but further evaluation is recommended with shallow obliques to assess for possible pulmonary nodule. Heart size is normal. Mediastinal silhouette and hilar contours are normal.
Impression: No acute intrathoracic process. Small focal opacity projects over the lateral right lower hemithorax. Shallow obliques off the frontal view are recommended for further evaluation. Findings and recommendations discussed with Dr. Covering for Dr. , by phone at : pm .
